information:
Chris Stapleton received six nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards. His nominations are for Male Artist of the Year, Entertainer of the Year, Album of the Year, Single of the Year, Music Event of the Year (with Carly Pearce), and Visual Media of the Year. Other top nominees include Ella Langley with eight nominations, and Cody Johnson and Morgan Wallen, who are tied with seven nominations each. Lainey Wilson also received six nominations.

Chris Stapleton has a history of success at industry awards. He has won 19 ACM Awards and 19 CMA Awards throughout his career. In November 2024, at the CMA Awards, he won four awards, including single and song of the year for 'White Horse' and was named male vocalist of the year for a record-extending eighth time. In February 2025, he won his 11th career Grammy Award for Best Country Solo Performance for the song 'It Takes A Woman'.

The 60th Academy of Country Music Awards are scheduled to take place on May 8, 2025, streaming live from the Ford Center at The Star in Frisco, Texas. Reba McEntire will host the event for the 18th time. The lineup of performers announced for the ceremony includes Chris Stapleton and Dua Lipa.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Yes. Chris Stapleton is a perennial winner at major country music awards shows, and with six nominations, it is highly probable he will win at least one.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Despite his numerous nominations, Stapleton faces incredibly stiff competition from other top nominees like Morgan Wallen, Cody Johnson, and Lainey Wilson. Voters could spread the awards, with other artists winning in the major categories, leading to Stapleton being shut out completely.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: With six nominations across major categories, Chris Stapleton wins in at least one. His consistent success makes him a favorite for Male Artist of the Year, and his recent CMA and Grammy wins could translate to a win for Single of the Year or Album of the Year.
forecast.rationale:
My forecast is based on Chris Stapleton's strong historical performance at the ACM awards and other major industry events, combined with his high number of nominations this year. Stapleton has received six nominations, including for Entertainer of the Year, Male Artist of the Year, and Album of the Year. An artist with this many nominations is rarely completely shut out. His track record includes 19 prior ACM awards, 19 CMA awards, and 11 Grammy awards, demonstrating consistent recognition from industry voters. His recent victories at the November 2024 CMA Awards (four wins) and the February 2025 Grammy Awards (one win) show he continues to be at the forefront of the genre. The status quo is that he wins awards when nominated.

My probability is not higher than 85% because the competition is exceptionally strong. Artists like Morgan Wallen, Cody Johnson, Ella Langley, and Lainey Wilson also have numerous nominations and significant commercial and critical success over the past year. There is a non-trivial chance that voters rally behind other artists, leading to Stapleton losing in all six categories.

My probability is not lower because his six nominations give him multiple paths to a single victory. The odds of losing in six separate categories, given his stature and history, are low. He is often considered a critical darling and a 'musician's musician,' which plays well with award show voters. A lower forecast would underweight his consistent, long-term success and the statistical advantage of having so many chances to win.

I would increase my forecast if pre-show industry buzz strongly favored him in a specific category. I would lower my forecast if a powerful narrative emerged for another artist to sweep the awards, potentially pulling votes away from Stapleton across the board.
